hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Volatility Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: The convergence of three catalysts (options expiry, BOJ policy, Coinbase launch) within a 72-hour window will break the current neutral regime, increasing 10-day realized volatility by >15 percentage points within 5 trading days, with the direction determined by which catalyst's market impact dominates.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Multiple uncorrelated catalysts hitting simultaneously reduce the probability of offsetting effects and increase the likelihood of a volatility regime shift. The current neutral regime (61.5% confidence) is susceptible to breakouts when confronted with concurrent fundamental, monetary policy, and ecosystem developments. Amplification occurs via trader repositioning across timeframes.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility <35% at hypothesis start
Two of three catalysts show confirming price action (e.g., BOJ→Yen down & COIN→stock up)
BTC price breaks 3% outside its 20-day Bollinger Band
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility continues to compress despite catalysts, or remains range-bound (<10% price movement from current levels), indicating stronger suppression forces.
